Key to species of the
Anthaxia ( Haplanthaxia ) schah
species-group

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Head and pronotum concolourous, bright green to golden green; pronotum with two variable dark discal maculae; antennae blueish-black; elytra with green or golden basal colouration, the rest widely suffused with golden-red to deep red-purple tinge ( Figs. 1 , 13 ); aedeagus slender ( Figs. 71, 76 ), about 6 times longer than wide.......
A. ( H. ) schah Abeille
de
Perrin, 1904
♂

- Entire body dark bronze, or copper-brown with occasional reddish or greenish lustre; pronotum with two indistinct dark discal maculae............................................................................................. 3

3 Body slender ( Fig. 7 , 21 ), proportionally longer (average length to width ratio: 3 times longer than wide); antennae black; frons (
Fig. 39
) and anterior part of pronotum with reddish or greenish lustre; pronotum weakly transversal, 1.3 times wider than long; legs slender, meso- and metatibiae weaker, straight or very slightly sinuate on inner side, with a strong, inner apical spur; tarsomeres moderately wide; claws long; elytral apices separately, regularly rounded; aedeagus proportionally shorter ( Figs. 74, 79 ), stouter, about 4.7 times longer than wide; ventral surface sexually dichromatic, bright green with golden lustre (
Fig. 22
)......................................................................... ..
A. (H.) naviauxi
Bílý, 1995
♂

- Body more stout ( Figs. 8 , 17 ), proportionally shorter (average length to width ratio: 2.7 times longer than wide); antennae blueish-black; frons with or without green tinge (
Fig. 37
); pronotum more transverse, 1.4 times wider than long; legs somewhat stouter and more sinuate on inner side, metatibiae rather widened, tarsomeres narrow; claws short; elytral apices separately, angularly rounded; aedeagus proportionally longer ( Figs. 72, 77 ), slender, about 6 times longer than wide; ventral surface not sexually dichromatic, reddish bronze to greenish bronze..................
A. ( H. ) wethloi Obenberger, 1904
♂
4 Body partially or completely green, with two dark pronotal spots................................................ 5
- Entire body dark bronze or copper-brown with reddish or greenish lustre; pronotum with two indistinct discal maculae..... 7

5 Body colouration blackish-green, bluish-green or bright green, only rarely coppery ( Figs. 25 , 89, 90, 91 ); head and pronotum occasionally very dark, nearly black; antennae slender, black ( Figs. 48, 53 ); elytra sometimes with slight golden lustre; pronotum distinctly sinuately narrowed posterior to mid length; anal ventrite with a narrow notch in both sexes ( Figs. 66, 67 ).....................................................................................
A. ( H. ) cadusiana
sp. nov.

- Head and pronotum concolourous, bright green to golden green with two variable dark pronotal spots; elytra with golden green basal colouration, the rest with reddish to deep red-purple tinge; pronotum rather rectilinearly narrowed posterior to mid length; anal ventrite with rather wider notch................................................................ 6
